meta.name: Bloodborne - City of the Unseen
meta.description: 8-scenario custom campaign where a mysterious 'sleeping sickness' strikes Arkham, Massachusetts
meta.author: aughhhh

cards.back_flavor:
Alfred was a boy who knew the weight of righteousness. He carried it in his bones, as if kindness and decency were his sword and shield. But there was a darkness blooming in him, a thing he could not name, and a thing others could not see underneath his kind eyes. When he came of age, he enrolled in Miskatonic University's seminary school in hopes of taming that darkness with piety and devotion.
     
But Alfred was a man now, and he knew that the desire to be a good person alone could never be enough. The whispers of cruelty, of hate, and of malice were always there in his quiet moments, blackening his soul. For the goodness in him to win, he would have to act- before it became too late.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian ([guardian]) cards level 0-3, Neutral cards 0-5, Cards that add, remove, or cancel doom level 0-5, up to 5 Mystic ([mystic]) cards level 0-3.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 Mystic cards.

cards.flavor: "Try stirring up trouble in this sorry state."
cards.name: Alfred Wheeler
cards.text:
[reaction]When an effect would cause an investigator at your location to take damage or horror: Add 1 doom to an asset under your control and cancel that effect.     
[free]: Take 1 horror: Remove 1 doom from an asset you control.
     
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each doom on assets you control.

cards.name: Piety
cards.text:
While Piety has 1 or more doom on it, Alfred Wheeler gets +1 [willpower] and +1 Sanity.
[reaction] If Piety has 2 or more doom on it, heal 1 horror from it at the end of your turn.

cards.name: Murderous Urges
cards.flavor: "There, you filthy monstrosity! All mangled and twisted, with every inside on the outside, for all the world to see!"
cards.text: Revelation – Put Murderous Urges into play with 1 doom on it. While Murderous Urges is in play, doom cannot be removed from assets under your control. [action]: For each doom on assets that you control, take 1 direct horror: Discard Murderous Urges.

cards.name: Cecily Jossef
cards.text: [reaction] If you end your turn with a Non-Elite enemy in your threat area, take 1 damage: Deal 1 damage to that enemy. (Limit once per round.) [reaction] If you end your turn with a non-Weakness treachery in your threat area, take 1 horror: Discover a clue at your location. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] +0. If you succeed: Automatically evade a non-Elite enemy or discard a non-Weakness treachery in your threat area.
cards.flavor: "Cheers to the discovery of kinship. Doesn't it make you feel warm inside?"
cards.back_flavor: Dr. Jossef's colleagues would describe her as unflinching and uncompromising, and Cecily would have previously been inclined to agree. Perhaps that is why she chose to enter the field of pediatrics after graduating summa cum laude from the Royal College of Physicians in Edinburgh; after all, children will do as they're told, while grown men will claim to know better than a lady doctor even as she holds the knife. After Arkham and the mysterious city of Yharnam merged together, however, Cecily can no longer claim to know how to describe herself at all; the two distinct voices that have appeared in her mind battle each other constantly, and Cecily fears that before long, there will be little of herself left when one of them finally assumes control.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30 Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose either Seeker ([seeker]) or Rogue ([rogue]). Deckbuilding Options: Mystic ([mystic]) level 0-3, Neutral cards 0-5, Trick cards 0-5, Science cards 0-3, up to 5 cards of your chosen secondary class level 0-3. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 copy of Dr. Jossef's Clarified Blood, 2 copies of Alternating Self, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 chosen secondary class cards.

cards.name: Cecily Jossef
cards.text: After you heal any amount of damage or horror from an investigator or Ally card: Shuffle an Event card from your discard pile back into your deck. [reaction] When a card effect would test your [intellect], take 1 damage: Test your highest stat instead. [elder_sign] +1. Draw a card. You may choose to discard a card.
cards.flavor: "Perhaps this will help, if only in some small way."
cards.back_flavor: Dr. Jossef's colleagues would describe her as unflinching and uncompromising, and Cecily would have previously been inclined to agree. Perhaps that is why she chose to enter the field of pediatrics after graduating summa cum laude from the Royal College of Physicians in Edinburgh; after all, children will do as they're told, while grown men will claim to know better than a lady doctor even as she holds the knife. After Arkham and the mysterious city of Yharnam merged together, however, Cecily can no longer claim to know how to describe herself at all; the two distinct voices that have appeared in her mind battle each other constantly, and Cecily fears that before long, there will be little of herself left when one of them finally assumes control.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30 Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose either Survivor ([survivor]) or Guardian ([guardian]). Deckbuilding Options: Mystic ([mystic]) level 0-3, Neutral cards 0-5, Spirit cards 0-5, Science Cards 0-3, up to 5 cards of your chosen secondary class level 0-3 Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 copy of Dr. Jossef's Clarified Blood, 2 copies of Alternating Self, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 chosen secondary class cards.

cards.name: Dr. Jossef's Clarified Blood
cards.text: [free] Choose an investigator at your location and exhaust Dr. Jossef's Clarified Blood. That investigator may play an Event card in their hand or from their discard pile at -2 cost. After that event resolves, remove it from the game. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Alternating Self
cards.flavor: "Cheers to the discovery of kinship. Doesn't it make you feel warm inside?"
cards.text: Cecily Jossef deck only. Revelation - If there is not an existing copy of Alternating Self in your threat area, put Alternating Self into play in your threat area. If there is an existing copy of Alternating Self in your threat area, shuffle this card back into your deck. Alternating Self can be healed as if it were a single point of horror on you (if it is healed, discard it.) While Alternating Self is in your threat area, swap the base value of your [combat] with your [intellect], and the value of your [willpower] with your [agility].

cards.name: Alternating Self
cards.flavor: "This can't be the real you... Please, stop... This can't be the real you..."
cards.text: Cecily Jossef deck only. Revelation - If there is not an existing copy of Alternating Self in your threat area, put Alternating Self into play in your threat area. If there is an existing copy of Alternating Self in your threat area, shuffle this card back into your deck. Alternating Self can be healed as if it were a single point of horror on you (if it is healed, discard it.) While Alternating Self is in your threat area, swap the base value of your [combat] with your [willpower], and the value of your [intellect] with your [agility].

cards.name: Djura Myswiliec
cards.text: You get one additional action each turn. This action may only be used on the following ability: [action] If a non-Elite, non-Weakness enemy is at your location: Test [intellect] (X). X is that enemy's Fight value. If you succeed, discover 1 clue at your location. If you succeed and that enemy has a supply token on it, shuffle that enemy back into the encounter deck. [elder_sign] +0. You may put a supply token from an asset you control on a non-Elite, non-Weakness enemy in play.
cards.flavor: "Go, I say. You have the whole night to dream. Make the best of it."
cards.back_flavor: Djura and Weronika Mysliwiec left their rural home in Poland in search of a better life, far from the conflict that would soon engulf continental Europe. They settled in Arkham and began a new chapter of their shared story, with Djura operating a drugstore pharmacy and Weronika raising two strapping young boys. But their peaceful existence would not last. When the Hunt claimed Arkham and its people, its violence stole Weronika away and Djura's two sons were transformed into terrible beasts. Djura often wonders why he, an old man, was spared when his family was not. His last hope is that if he can undo the horrors that have befallen his city, there might be some way to see his loved ones again—that is, if he can survive to see its end.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor ([survivor]) level 0-3, Neutral cards 0-5, Cards that cancel or ignore attacks or damage level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 2 copies of Numbing Mist, 1 copy of Survivor's Guilt, 1 random basic weakness.

text: Cancel up to [0-9]+ of that damage

cards.name: Numbing Mist
cards.text: Djura Myswiliec deck only. Uses (3 Supplies). If Numbing Mist has no remaining Supplies, discard it. [free] If a non-Elite enemy is engaged with you, place 1 supply on it: Disengage from that enemy. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot engage you.

cards.name: Survivor's Guilt
cards.text: Revelation - Move each Non-Elite enemy in play one location toward you. Each enemy that enters your location as a result of this effect attacks you. If no enemies are moved by this effect, take 1 horror and shuffle Survivor's Guilt back into your deck.
cards.flavor: The reverse of the photograph reads: Mysliwiec Family Portrait, 1920. Piotr, Djura, Antoni.

cards.name: Eileen MacRoe
cards.flavor: "Do try to keep your hands clean, won't you? Leave the dirty work to me."
cards.text: Forced – Non-Elite enemies do not engage you during the enemy phase. You get one additional action each turn, which may only be used to Fight or Evade an enemy you are engaged with. [elder_sign] effect: +0. If you succeed, you may take a free action to Fight or Evade an enemy you are engaged with. (Limit once per Round.)
cards.back_flavor: Eileen MacRoe has been an enforcer for the O'Bannion gang for longer than she can remember, and she has a long memory. Her travels often take her far from Arkham as the arbiter of the long arm of the gang's preferred style of justice, but she's approaching her sixties and at this point she'd vastly prefer a life of comfortable retirement. But as long as there are small-time crooks who think they're slick enough to get a leg up on the O'Bannions, Eileen will never find herself short of work.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue ([rogue]) cards level 0-3, Neutral cards 0-5, Cards that "engage" or "disengage" level 0-5, up to 5 Guardian ([guardian]) cards level 0-3. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 copy of Blades of Mercy, 1 copy of Jack Crawford, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You can only have 5 of these specific cards

deck_options.name: Guardian cards
deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 Guardian cards.

cards.name: Blades of Mercy
cards.text: While Blades of Mercy is in your play area, you may use your [agility] in place of [combat] when taking Fight actions. [action]: Fight. This attack does +1 damage and you get +1 to this attack. If you succeed by 3 or more and the enemy was non-Elite, you may exhaust Blades of Mercy to automatically evade that enemy.

cards.name: Jack Crawford
cards.text: Hunter. Prey – Eileen MacRoe only. Jack Crawford cannot be evaded by his prey. Forced – If Jack Crawford deals damage to Eileen MacRoe: Shuffle him into his bearer's deck.
cards.flavor: "We're getting too old for this song and dance, Jack."

cards.name: Walter Garnett
cards.flavor: "Haven't you seen enough of these wretched beasts and mad doctors?"
cards.text: Forced – At the beginning of the investigation phase, discard all non-story Ally assets under your control in play. [reaction] At the beginning of your turn, you may play an Ally asset from your hand or discard pile at -2 cost. Ally assets under your control that give +[willpower], +[intellect], +[combat], or +[agility] give +1 more to those stats. [elder_sign]: +1. Ignore the next time your forced effect would trigger.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose Guardian ([guardian]), Rogue ([rogue]), or Survivor ([survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: Cards of your chosen class level 0-3, Neutral cards 0-5, Ally cards 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 copy of Master of the League, 1 copy of Vermin, 1 Random Basic Weakness.
cards.back_flavor: Garnett was once a fixture of the decadent society elite of Arkham's upper class, wasting his wealth away in pursuit of idle leisure. But when Arkham was done away with and the city of Yharnam took its place, Garnett was cast into the dark heart of the Forbidden Woods. There, he discovered he possessed a quality rare among his peers: the heart of a true survivor. The world beyond his former gilded cage now holds infinite possibilities for Garnett, who invites you to join him at the inaugural meeting of the Arkham League of Extraordinary Gentlemen Adventures. The gathering promises, at the very least, to be an exciting affair.

cards.name: Master of the League
cards.text: [reaction] When your Forced effect discards an Ally asset from play, you may choose to attach it to this card instead. (Maximum 3 cards attached.) [free] Exhaust Master of the League: Resolve a [action] or [free] ability printed on an Ally card attached to Master of the League, ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle that card back into your deck.

cards.name: Vermin
cards.text: Revelation – For each Ally asset in your discard pile, choose 1: [bullet]Remove that card from the game. [bullet]Put that card in your threat area face down as a 1 damage, 2 fight, 1 health, 2 evade Infested enemy. If there are no ally cards in your discard pile, take 1 horror and shuffle Vermin into your deck.

cards.name: Yamamura Isao
cards.text:
[reaction] After you draw a [curse] token during a test, you may cancel that token and return it to the chaos bag. Add another [curse] to the bag and draw another token. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign]: +1. Add or remove a [curse] token from the chaos bag.
cards.flavor: "The bonds that tie us are so deeply amusing! Don't you think?"
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker ([seeker]) cards level 0-3, Neutral cards 0-5, Cursed cards 0-5, up to 5 Rogue ([rogue]) cards level 0-3. Deckbuilding Requirements: 1 copy of Heirloom Fountain Pen, 1 copy of Kegare, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.back_flavor: The Ashina Curse has loomed over Isao's family bloodline for generations, dooming his ancestors to lives filled with misery and hardship. A painter and poet of immeasurable skill, Yamamura rationalized to his wife and child that outrunning the curse was the only way to ensure his family's safety as he left them behind. In truth, his wife and child were simply shackles, and the Ashina Curse a convenient justification for Yamamura to leave home in search of a life of excitement and indulgence. After all, who would be foolish enough to believe in things like curses?

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 Rogue cards.

cards.name: Heirloom Fountain Pen
cards.text: Fast. You get +1 [intellect]. [reaction] When you add a [curse] token to the chaos bag, exhaust Heirloom Fountain Pen: Gain 1 resource and draw a card.
cards.flavor:
You lost your shadow; I'm giving it back to you. Beautifully done.
Death Poem of the Owl

cards.name: Kegare
cards.text: Revelation – Put Kegare into play in your threat area. Kegare can be healed as if it were a single point of damage or horror on you (if it is healed, discard it.) Forced – After drawing a [curse] token: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.
cards.flavor: Once, an honorable warrior pursued a beast for equally honorable revenge. But when he stared straight into impurity, it drove him mad.
